Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian

Class ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorViaMutualInfo
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateViaMutualInfo
        • infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian.ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActiveInfoStorageCalculator, ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariate, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    public class ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian
extends ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateViaMutualInfo
    An Active Information Storage (AIS) calculator for multivariate time-series data (implementing ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariate) which is affected using a Gaussian Mutual Information (MI) calculator (MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian) to make the calculations.

    That is, this class implements an AIS calculator using model of Gaussian variables with linear interactions. This is achieved by plugging in MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian as the calculator into the parent class ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorViaMutualInfo.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariate, with:

    • The constructor step being a simple call to ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian().
    • ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateViaMutualInfo.setProperty(String, String) allowing properties for MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian.setProperty(String, String) (except MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.PROP_TIME_DIFF as outlined in ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateViaMutualInfo.setProperty(String, String))
    • Computed values are in nats, not bits!

    References:

    • J.T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A.Y. Zomaya, "Local measures of information storage in complex distributed computation", Information Sciences, vol. 208, pp. 39-54, 2012.
    Author:
    Pedro AM Mediano (email, www), Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariate, ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateViaMutualInfo, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian

      • computeSignificance

        public ChiSquareMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance()
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate an analytic distribution of what the AIS would look like, under a null hypothesis that our variables had no relation. This is performed without bootstrapping (which is done in #computeSignificance(int, int) and #computeSignificance(int, int[][])). The method is implemented using the corresponding method of the underlying MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian

        See Section II.E "Statistical significance testing" of the JIDT paper below, and the other papers referenced in AnalyticNullDistributionComputer.computeSignificance() (in particular Brillinger and Geweke), for a description of how this is done for MI. Basically, the null distribution is a chi-square distribution.

        Returns:
        ChiSquareMeasurementDistribution object which describes the proportion of AIS scores from the null distribution which have higher or equal AISs to our actual value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        "J.T. Lizier, 'JIDT: An information-theoretic toolkit for studying the dynamics of complex systems', 2014."
